trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Plainfield
There were no other sightings in Plainfield on or around May 29th 2011
divs: Sighting DetailsI was standing in my driveway talking with some friends when I looked up at the stars. Number one appeared as a bright flash to my SW. It was like a meteorite lasting only a few seconds from south to north. Number two started a south to north track east of number one. It came directly overheaed. As I turned to keep watching it, I lost it or it disapeared. Number three started a south to north long track east of number two almost overhead. It continues north as number four apears west of three. Number four starts a long track north to south, then turns on a long arc to the east. Each of these eventually disapear. 3 and 4 are the longest viewed ones, about a min or two apiece. I thought they were aircraft, but they had no nav lights or strobes, only a single white light. I then thought maybe satalites, but so many in one part of the sky is unusual. All four looked like high altitude objects. No other aircraft were seen in the area.
Summary: Four star like objects moving in seperate directions.
